summary: Federal financial regulatory agencies collect and maintain a large amount of consumers' personally identifiable information (PII) for the oversight of banks and credit unions. Protecting PII—which is often shared with other agencies, law enforcement, and contractors—is critical. The 5 financial regulators we reviewed have processes to protect PII that meet most recommended key practices. But 4 of the regulators didn't fully follow key practices in...
title: Privacy: Federal Financial Regulators Should Take Additional Actions to Enhance Their Protection of Personal Information
